comments.commentBody:
Not surprised, that the thoughtful man made sure to contain the damage of the degenerate and made sure to protect our allies from Putin's anti democratic shenanigans.

Thank you President Obama. We will need another paragon of virtue to much your moral stature in picking up the pieces, like you did after the wrecking ball years of the previous Republican administration.

replies.commentBody: Your prescience abounds. I sure hope the remaining principled members of this tainted Tea Party GOP step up with Teddy Roosevelt big stick and wallop the rest of the cowards into action. Fox News can't shame the whole party at once and, once the truth comes out, those that acted will be heroes, on the right side of history.

Claire McCaskell says in her ten years on the Armed Services Committee she never "ever" had reason to contact Russians because that is the purview of the Foreign Affairs Committee.

So what was Sessions discussing?
sessions should be indicted, prosecuted and jailed for treason.

comments.commentBody: I wonder if the GOP will now agree that Sessions should probably recuse himself? You know, since it now it looks like he might end up having to investigate his own criminal acts.

replies.commentBody: The Post adopted a tagline for the first time in their history:  "Democracy Dies in Darkness".
The only thing that is ugly is the constant smear job the NY Times is now engaged in.
Where did they publish Hillary's emails ...?

comments.commentBody:
To the New York Times and The Washington Post:

KEEP DOING YOUR JOB!! The American public "can handle the truth", no matter how ugly it is.....and appears to be.

KEEP DOING YOUR JOB!! The American public has your back and you have our support that can't be measured by the number of subscribers.

KEEP DOING YOUR JOB!! Our American democracy may very well depend on it.

replies.commentBody: Obama...Pelosi...McCain...Reid best them to it.
Does anyone think Bond movie and Bond conspiracy?

comments.commentBody:
What "they" (congressional repubs, Trump, Bannon, Seesions, etc.) want is to consolidate wealth in the hands of the right-thinking ultra-rich. All of their actions indicate this, regardless of the various ideological facades they present.
What is truly surprising is the extent of the bare-faced betrayal of the nation they are willing to commit to achieve this goal; it is breath-taking.

replies.commentBody: It's about as fictional as that, yes.
No, this is no mystery.  Trump is a traitor.
Or, maybe even more apt, John le Carré, Ian Fleming, or Fletcher Knebel & Charles Bailey, II!

comments.commentBody: This is all something out of a Dan Brown, type, Da Vinci Code novel, right?

replies.commentBody:
Obama reads a great deal.
He monitors himself to check his motives .
He is careful whom he listens to.
He weighs matters in his mind.
He takes advice .
He is willing to admit when he's wrong.
He is Presidential .
(OK ,sometimes he slips up, but you get my drift !)

comments.commentBody:
Obama comes across as a low key guy, but he's nobody's fool. He knew Donald's motives from square one.

It's criminal that we have to rely on the media to keep so many of our politicians in line. Looks like term limits are necessary for most high-level positions, in spite of the value of experience. Power corrupts.

replies.commentBody:
Really? If you don't get "Deep Throat" right this minute then there must not be any "there" there? You can't imagine how difficult it must be to find all the evidence that WITHOUT A DOUBT points back to the Trumpy campaign? You can't imagine that the Trumpy administration is doing everything in its power to keep the information from being divulged by the "fake news" media?
.
An investigation that eventually will implicate the president and his campaign in stealing the election through collusion with the Russians is not going to happen overnight. And Trumpy and his Minions of Deceit will do EVERYTHING and ANYTHING in their power to keep Americans from knowing about their treason.

I'm not sure why everyone is so quick to trust Obama. He's been known to lie, and he certainly knows how to push this type of narrative, which the media dutifully reports as truth. This could be just one more of his dirty political tricks.

I'll reserve judgement until the FBI reports.

You expect instant gratification for something this big? As in an hour-long television crime drama?
There is much truth-digging to be done before we will learn everything.
In the meantime, the media must protect its sources or lose them. Remember: Putin has had whistle-blowers assassinated.
Or do you think this is fake news?

comments.commentBody: I am so TIRED of hearing this stuff without a smoking gun.  NY Times, WHERE is your Deep Throat?  Why can't you get the meat of this "intelligence" published  once and for all, if there's actually any meat to bite into?

replies.commentBody: It was Democrat President Obama who insisted on being allowed to have a private phone the contents of which would not become part of the public record. I guess he left and received messages on that piece of illegal equipment with contacts he didn't want Americans to know about.
..... and the Secretary of State using unsecured devices, such as an illegal computer in her bathroom did what for national security?

This wasn't from russian hacking. This came from wiretaps from the FBI and American intel agencies. As a matter of routine all telephone calls from ambassadors are recorded. That was how Flynn was caught, he spoke on the phone to the russian ambassador and talked openly about the sanctions.
Which was stupid considering he had been in intel and knew phones were tapped.

comments.commentBody: Considering the Republican candidate was known to use an unsecured device, it would be easy for him to leave "notes" on that device and then have the Russians hack that device and leave "notes" of their own.
If verified than in a word TREASON

If anything further on this develops you can be sure of two things: Bannon, Spicer and Conway will scream bloody of the "fake news" and something outrageous will come up to distract the public. His supporters will become more zealous.
Let's hope we'll start hearing cries of "Lock them up."

replies.commentBody: Much ado about nothing. How long is it going to take you to heal from Hillary's loss? Democrats own self-inflicted loss? Go read some Shakespeare. It should  help.
And tell us what happened to the info about her illegal server and phones?

comments.commentBody:
Trump wanted to crucify Hilary Clinton over the email server.
Now it's time for Trump to learn about reaping what you sow.

Can't really trust Comey or the FBI to do an investigation, given recent FBI events and the internal disputes there. Watergate WAS domestic--this is international and way more important.   The Senate has to step up on this, but in a Republican controlled house and senate, they will drag their feet because they fear it will hurt their blessed tax cuts, attacks on the poor and people of color, ignorant nationalism and bullsheet Law-and-Orderism.

replies.commentBody: Have you forgotten Hillary's stupid "Reset" button she presented the Russians with?

He does want to get along with Mexico he just wants to renegotiate the trade deal as for Russia they're the second largest superpower in the world with thousands of thermonuclear warheads pointed at us. It makes sense to want to make peace with these people. The military industrial complex along with their purveyors, the neoconservatives in BOTH parties, want a war against Syria and Russia. Trump threatens that whole scenario with peace. Wake up and quit consuming the corporate media line ...you people are such suckers.

comments.commentBody:
What is up with Trump's strange interest in the struggling 12th largest economy in the world (behind Brazil and Italy). Why doesn't Trump mind pissing off Mexico who is the 15th largest economy and 3rd largest trading partner with the us?
Russia is 30th largest trading partner.

So why does Trump think it would be "so good to get along with Russia" but not Mexico?
Why did Russia hack Trump's adversary?
What is up with his claim to have talked to Putin personally, then later recanting of that statement?
Why did he hire a guy like Manafort who had ties to the Kremlin as his Campaign Manager?
Why Rex Tillerson who is a friend of Russia?

Russia is our enemy.

Putin is our enemy.
Trump, though, loves the guy.

replies.commentBody: There are those brave enough to speak truth to power, and those craven enough to speak power to truth.

No, it's a contest between the people's power and the corruption of the MSM and the Obama Admin.There's no coincidence that this would be written the day after a triumphant speech.

It has been said time after time by all investigating this that There. Is. No. Evidence.

They knew HRC was going to lose. Anyone truly paying attention did. All of this was fabricated the minute the looming loss became undeniable.

You people and your inability to think is astounding.

What is treasonous? Talking to ambassador of a country?

Why did FBI release notes on hillary if they knew it came from Russia? The fact that DNC wanted to sidelines Bernie and sharing that is treasonous?

No one is thinking this through, and presenting anything but none sense and emotion. No facts.

comments.commentBody: This is treason.  This will be a contest between Trump's power versus the truth.

replies.commentBody: It's forgotten the next day because there is nothing there. The brouhaha are these stupid accusations by sore losers making mountains our of molehills. They are a virus within our government.

comments.commentBody:
If nothing else the timing of this piece is perfect. The White House chaos seems to have created a news cycle where every unthinkable lie and deed by Trump is reported and then forgotten in the next day's brouhaha, never to be visited again.
It appeared that Trump and the G.O.P. had once again managed this slight
of hand and that his ability to read from a teleprompter would dominate the news for days. Obviously, not so.
At this moment I envision Donald,wrestling with sobbing aides, trying to grab back his cell phone, as he screams "give it back! Give it back! I don't care if they fell for the speech. I GOTTA TWEET NOW!!!"

If there is truly "no there there" as Spicer says, then what is the harm in allaying all fears by a Congressional investigation? We spent millions of tax payer dollars on repeated investigations of Bengazi and Clinton's emails, personally I would be fine with a few more of my hard earned tax dollars looking into this. Yeesh-the head of the American branch of law enforcement lied to Congress about talking to the Russians-you either did ot you did not.

But NO-lets make sure Congress investigates the Parks Dept and Bryce Canyon conspiracy-now THERE is a true threat to American Democracy!!

replies.commentBody:
"So, Republicans in Congress, will there EVER be a point where you put COUNTRY OVER PARTY?"
Rhetorical question, right? The Republicans bought and paid for their seats in Congress, governor's mansions, and state houses across the country. Where they can buy judgeships, they've done that, too. Republicans aren't statesmen, patriots, ideologues, or public servants, they are business people. If letting Trump make a few bucks out of his Russian connections, or selling out Eastern Europe to Putin keeps the bucks flowing, the Republicans are OK with that. There's money to be made in those military contracts and that EXXON deal with Russia, and those tax breaks are just what the Koch brothers ordered. No way are they going to let the gravy train slow down just because their buddy Sessions "forgot" he met with the Russian ambassador.

comments.commentBody:
Washington Post now reporting that Sessions met with Russian ambassador during the campaign, yet denied it twice (i.e., lied about it twice) when asked directly during his confirmation process whether he had had any contact with Russian government officials during the campaign.

So, Republicans in Congress, will there EVER be a point where you put COUNTRY OVER PARTY? Sessions MUST go. And, an independent special prosecutor MUST be appointed to investigate Trump's ties to Putin/Russia.

replies.commentBody: You have the ability to read this only one way, how lucky for you.
Well said.  I totally agree.

and remember that all on line news is minimally supported by the subscription cost (if they even have one). To do deep investigations, all news organizations need steady income. So click those ads where you read the on-line news of your choice.   The advertisers often pay per eyeball that goes to their site.

comments.commentBody:
As a subscriber, I am so proud of the New York Times for keeping the faith and practicing journalism for the greater good.

My subscription to the NYT is money very well spent.

replies.commentBody: Now you know how many of us felt for 8 years of Obama. Just sayin'!

In defense of the polls and pollsters, they actually didn't get it wrong.  The polls always included a margin of error, and often included a probability estimate of the likelihood of victory for each candidate.  Trump was almost always stated as having at least a one in three chance of winning.  We ignored that, and pretended that a greater likelihood amounted to certainty.  Trump loves to discredit the polls by saying they were wrong about him.  But that's the wrong lesson, for both sides.  We need to learn that probability is just that, not to become complacent if we seem to have an edge or stop trying if the odds aren't in our favor.

These comments are GREAT ....how can I print them all out in total?

Much better than the Far Side ...

keep them coming!!!!

comments.commentBody: I have been depressed since election and felt so unsettled for 3 months about this. Pissed off at the people who voted for him, pissed off at pollsters who got it wrong etc. I know I was not alone, but then the inauguration came and trump settled in and nothing made sense. But now it does and it's so breathtaking and unnerving ar same time. Thank you the the free media and their hard work. I'm proud to be an American again.

To paraphrase Chico Marx:

Who are you going to believe, Donald Trump and his cronies or your own lying eyes?

There is a pattern of traitorous or even treasonous behavior from the Republican presidential campaigns going back nearly half a century: Ronald Reagan's campaign colluded with Iranians to prevent the American hostages from being released while Jimmy Carter was president -- miraculously, they were released moments after Reagan was inaugurated. Then, the Reagan-ites SOLD WEAPONS TO THOSE SAME IRANIANS (whom they would later include in their "Axis of Evil") in order to skirt (or break?) laws so they could overthrow a democratically elected Latin-American government. Nixon's campaign, we recently learned, illegally sabotaged Lyndon Johnson's effort to end the Vietnam War, leading to thousands of unnecessary American casualties. And now, the Republican Trump campaign works with a nation that poses perhaps the greatest military threat to America in order to win the 2016 election.

IS THIS PATTERN NOT OBVIOUS?

replies.commentBody: Perhaps we could donate funds to an escrow account to pay legal bills, fines, lost income, and security.
Count me in.

Excellent, excellent idea. But my fear is that once the reward is offered, trumps returns may disappear into oblivion.......if they haven't already. My hope is that someone already has a copy and is just waiting for the right time to turn them over.

comments.commentBody: I wonder if it is against the law if we all pitched in $10 dollars and collectively created a $ gazillion dollar reward for the first person who turns over Trump's tax returns to NYT?
"Make Russia great again" (V.Putin)

replies.commentBody: Madam: a small point -- there is a very, very big difference between the "Russian intelligentsia" and "Russian intelligence."  To wit: Russian intelligence has been trying for decades to destroy the members of the Russian intelligentsia who have been trying to expose the filth and rotten corruption that, in Moscow, doubles for governance.

comments.commentBody:
What a huge story and my deep gratitude goes out to President Obama and his staff for laying the groundwork for future investigations into collusion with Russian intelligentsia to sway our election. I am deeply grateful to The NY Times for their investigative reporting. I have never been more proud of being a subscriber.
In my minds eye I can see team Trump uncovering the trail of the crumbs and knowing he can only exist in the vacuum of his Russian puppet cabinet. It must be of little balm for Spicer to yell fake news and exclude the NYT as President Trump becomes unhinged by what he knows will be known. That will be a great story too.

replies.commentBody: "Posterity! You will never know the price this generation paid for you freedom. I hope you use it well." --John Adams 1777
Hear, hear!

comments.commentBody: Barack Obama is a truly Patriotic figure who preserved the truth for posterity. The ultimate truth will survive any corruption in investigations. It will be the final word after the dust settles. I'm deeply grateful Mr. President.
